cpl.readme:
[[Axios|https://axios-http.com/]] is a popular promise-based HTTP client for making asynchronous HTTP requests in JavaScript. It works on both the client and server-side environments and can be used to communicate with any back-end or API that exposes an HTTP interface. Axios supports a wide range of features such as interceptors, request cancellation, automatic transformation of JSON data, support for different types of responses (JSON, XML, Buffer), and more. Overall, it provides an easy-to-use and powerful interface for handling HTTP requests and responses.

Usage:

```
const axios = require('$:/plugins/Gk0Wk/axios/axios.min.js');
```

Then, if you use [[Tiddly.ModernDev|https://github.com/tiddly-gittly/Modern.TiddlyDev]]:

```
import axios from '$:/plugins/Gk0Wk/axios/axios.min.js';
```

> This plugin uses the flexible and powerful <$text text="TiddlyWiki" /> development framework [[Tiddly.ModernDev|https://github.com/tiddly-gittly/Modern.TiddlyDev]]
